title: anybody up on the AFP font format?
content:
I'm looking for someone to convert a Type 1 font to IBM's proprietary AFP format for use on a mainframe printer (IOW, variable data). the catalog of fonts in AFP format is surprisingly limited (as far as our rep has informed me). fortunately, I was able to uncover enough info about AFP to learn that Type 1 can be repackaged in such a way that it will work on this platform.

as always, our timeline is virtually non-existant, so any info would be much appreciated.
author: plainclothes

comments.content: Look [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010211109/http:/www.isis-papyrus.com/e/pages/productsheets/2/ovfonteditor.html). This appears to be exactly what you're looking for, but I'm not sure about licensing issues.

BitFonter can import and export in AFP format:

[http://www.fontlab.com/Font-tools/BitFonter/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010211109/http:/www.fontlab.com/Font-tools/BitFonter/ "http://www.fontlab.com/Font-tools/BitFonter/")
